page.title: 17Bubbenhall:The Church
page.content: St.Giles church was built in 1385,of red and yellow sandstone.It is situated on high ground so it is safe from flooding.It is in good condition as the stones were redressed in 1984.There are c.60 gravestones surrounding the church,which are weathered by wind,rain,snow and frost.The doors were added in 1984,made of oak and costing Â£800.The tower was repaired in 1976.The clock is 200 years old.The church has 3 bells.The stained glass windows of saints,made by Kemp,feature abushel of wheat-his trade mark.Another feature is the wooden beamed ceiling.One of the greatest treasures is a 700 year old chalice,currently valued at almost Â£10000.The church registers date from: Marriage 1838,Baptism 1914,Burial 1813.
